Entries.preloader.requirements-failed.title: System Warning
Entries.preloader.requirements-failed.no-compute: Your GPU ('<gpu-name/>') does not support compute shaders. Please ensure your system meets the minimum system requirements. You can also try updating your Graphics Drivers.
Entries.preloader.requirements-failed.not-enough: Your GPU ('<gpu-name/>') does not have enough VRAM (<gpu-vram/> MB). <required-vram/> MB VRAM is required at least. Please ensure your system meets the minimum system requirements.
Your System does not have enough memory (<memory/> MB). <required-memory/> MB Memory is required at least. Please ensure your system meets the minimum system requirements.
Entries.preloader.requirements-failed.bad-os-win: Your operating system version (<os-version/>) is not supported. Please ensure your system meets the minimum system requirements (Windows <minimum-os-version/> or newer).
Entries.preload.graphic-quality.title: Graphics Quality
Entries.preload.graphic-quality.description: You can also adjust the quality in the settings later.
Entries.preload.graphic-quality.low-end-gpu-warn: Integrated/Low End GPU () is being used. Using Presets other than 'Minimum' might crash the game.
Entries.preload.telemetry.title: Privacy
Entries.preload.telemetry.description:
To improve the game, we would like to collect anonymized statistics and data about balancing, playtime, level completion time, crashes, performance & system statistics, settings, and achievements. 

This also involves using a third-party service called "Unity Analytics".

All data is sent anonymously and cannot be traced back to you.

If you are interested in the details, you can also check our <link:privacy-policy>Privacy Policy</link>.
Entries.preload.changelog.description: Here are the changes since you last played - You can also view them at any time in the Main Menu using About - Changelog.
Entries.preload.dev-warning.title: Dev Warning
Entries.preload.dev-warning.warning-main: You are playing an unreleased, development version of the game. Please agree to continue:
Entries.preload.dev-warning.warning-0: Sharing screenshots/videos outside the Shapez 2 Discord is NOT permitted.
Entries.preload.dev-warning.warning-1: Bugs, issues & feedback should be reported in the Shapez 2 Discord.

Entries.menu.settings.title: Settings
Entries.menu.settings.graphics.confirm-dialog.de: Are you sure you want to keep these settings?
Entries.menu.settings.graphics.pending-leave-dia: Do you want to apply the changes you made to the display settings?
Entries.menu.settings.general.pending-setting-ch: The changes will only take effect after restarting the game.
Entries.menu.settings.graphic-preset.minimal.des: Best suited for integrated/low-end GPUs or laptops. (Very ugly)
Entries.menu.settings.graphic-preset.low.descrip: For older devices or laptops generally.
Entries.menu.settings.graphic-preset.high.descri: For somewhat recent GPUs and Systems, i.e. GTX 1050 TI and above.
Entries.menu.settings.graphic-preset.extreme.des: Requires a decent GPU, especially on WQHD and 4k.
Entries.menu.setting.resolution.description: The window resolution. Recommended to set to the same as your monitor resolution.
Entries.menu.setting.music-volume.description: The volume of the music tracks.
Entries.menu.setting.sfx-volume.description: The general volume of all sound effects.
Entries.menu.setting.master-volume.description: The overall game volume, including music and sound effects.
Entries.menu.setting.buildings-volume.descriptio: Volume of the sounds from individual buildings, when zooming in close.
Entries.menu.setting.ambience-volume.description: Volume of the space ambience or conveyor belt ambience.
Entries.menu.setting.ui-volume.description: Volume of interface sound effects, i.e. buttons & notifications.
Entries.menu.setting.mute-in-background.descript: If enabled, the game will be muted while the window is not focused.
Entries.menu.setting.tutorial.description: Highly recommended, enables the tutorial & general tips to succeed in the game.
Determines the color mixing scheme used by the game. This is purely visual and can be changed any time.
Entries.menu.setting.antialiasing.description: Decreases artifacts at the edges of objects. MSAA is very performance intensive, and SMAA is very cheap. If you are playing on 4k, SMAA is highly recommended.
Entries.menu.setting.ambient-occlusion.descripti: Increases the visual quality using screen space ambient occlusion. Can be very performance intensive on low-end setups.
Entries.menu.setting.shadow-quality.description: Controls the resolution and quality of the shadows. Higher quality shadows require more GPU memory.
Entries.menu.setting.shader-quality.description: Controls the shader quality & effects. On lower values, disables effects that are not relevant for gameplay.
Entries.menu.setting.ui-scale.description: Controls the size of the user interface.
Entries.menu.setting.viewport-snapping.descripti: Snaps the camera while rotating to increments, i.e. with 90 degrees snapping the camera automatically snaps to either North, East, South or West.
Entries.menu.setting.anisotropic-filtering.descr: Increases texture quality at steep angles, especially on the floor grid texture.
Entries.menu.setting.vsync.description: Sync the maximum frame rate to your monitor refresh rate. Highly recommended. You can also sync it to half your refresh rate with '2nd VBlank' for example.
Entries.menu.setting.fps-limit.description: Limits the maximum frames per second, but might introduce stuttering. Using VSync instead is highly recommended!
Entries.menu.setting.window-mode.description: When using Vulkan (the default on Windows), Borderless works as Fullscreen instead.
Entries.menu.setting.background-details.descript: Controls the amount of details and decorations for the space background.
Entries.menu.setting.island-details.description: Controls the details of the space platforms, lower values use less detailed meshes at the cost of visual quality.
Entries.menu.setting.building-details.descriptio: Controls the details of the buildings, lower values use less detailed meshes and animations at the cost of visual quality.
Entries.menu.setting.autosave-interval.descripti: The game saves a backup of the savegame every once in a while. You can control the interval here.
Entries.menu.setting.post-processing.description: Enables color grading, vignette and outline. Very cheap, so disabling it is not recommended.
Entries.menu.setting.interface-effects.descripti: Enables effects on the user interface. Very cheap, so disabling it is not recommended.
Entries.menu.setting.savegame-backup-count.descr: The game automatically deletes old backups, but keeps a set of recent backups, as well as every 50th backup. Control here how many backups to keep at least.
Entries.menu.setting.mouse-camera-drag-sensitivi: Controls how fast the camera moves when you drag with the mouse to the left/right.
Controls how fast the camera moves when you drag with the mouse to the top/bottom.
Entries.menu.setting.keyboard-camera-speed.descr: Controls how fast the camera moves when you move it with the keyboard.
Entries.menu.setting.mouse-border-pan.descriptio: If enabled, the camera automatically moves when you move your mouse cursor to the screen borders.
Entries.menu.setting.mouse-border-pan-speed.desc: Controls the speed of the screen panning.
Entries.menu.setting.confine-mouse-cursor.descri: If enabled, prevents your cursor from leaving the window while playing. Does not work on all platforms.
Entries.menu.setting.invert-zoom.description: If enabled, inverts the direction the camera zooms when you use the scroll wheel.
Entries.menu.setting.zoom-sensitivity.descriptio: Controls how fast the camera zooms in/out when you use the scroll wheel.
Entries.menu.setting.move-camera-with-layers.des: By default, the camera also moves up and down when you switch a floor. You can disable it here to make the camera always stay at the same position.
Entries.menu.setting.telemetry.description: Whether to send anonymized analytics to help improving the game.
Entries.menu.setting.language.description: Please note that some languages are community translated, and the quality/completeness may differ depending on the language.
Entries.menu.setting.copy-bp-to-clipboard.descri: When enabled, automatically copies any selection to your system clipboard so you can share it with others or paste it again quickly.
Entries.menu.setting.menu-transitions.descriptio: You can disable the menu animations if you experience motion sickness.
Entries.menu.setting.simulation-mode.description: For internal testing only. Controls how the simulation is processed.

Entries.game-rule.GRNoSplitters.title: No Splitters
Entries.game-rule.GRNoSplitters.description: You can not split any conveyor belts anymore, although merging is still possible.

Entries.game-rule.GRStartAtBlueprints.descriptio: Directly start at the blueprints milestone, skipping the very early part of the game.
Entries.keybinding.main.undo.description: Undo your last operation, almost everything can be undone but there is a limit of 100 operations.
Entries.keybinding.main.redo.description: Redo an operation you previously used undo for.
Entries.keybinding.main.toggle-pause.description: Pauses or resumes the game, this usually is not necessary, but we included it for convenience.
Entries.keybinding.main.toggle-ui.description: Toggles the interface, useful for creating screenshots.
Entries.keybinding.main.scope-change.description: Toggle between platform and building mode. This also automatically happens while zooming.
Entries.keybinding.main.screenshot.description: Take a screenshot. The screenshot will be saved to your user folder.
Entries.keybinding.camera.rotate-cw.description: Rotate the Camera clockwise. The amount depends on your Camera Snapping setting.
Entries.keybinding.camera.rotate-ccw.description: Rotate the Camera counter-clockwise. The amount depends on your Camera Snapping setting.
Entries.keybinding.camera.move-right.description: Hold to move the camera to the right.
Entries.keybinding.camera.move-left.description: Hold to move the camera to the left.
Entries.keybinding.camera.move-up.description: Hold to move the camera to the top.
Entries.keybinding.camera.move-down.description: Hold to move the camera to the bottom.
Entries.keybinding.camera.move-faster.descriptio: Hold while using the 'Move left/right/up/down' buttons to move faster.
Entries.keybinding.camera.mouse-drag-modifier.de: Hold this key/button and drag to move the camera.
Entries.keybinding.camera.angle-drag-modifier.de: Hold and move the mouse to change the camera angle. Moving left/right changes the rotation, and up/down changes the angle.
Entries.keybinding.camera.select-layer-up.descri: Move one floor up. Use WHILE dragging Belts to place a Lift.
Entries.keybinding.camera.select-layer-down.desc: Move one floor down. Use WHILE dragging Belts to place a Lift.
Entries.keybinding.camera.toggle-show-all-layers: Toggles the visibility of structures <highlight>above</highlight> the current floor.
Entries.keybinding.camera.zoom-in.description: You can bind this a key to allow zooming the camera without a scroll wheel.
Entries.keybinding.camera.angle-up.description: You can bind this a key to allow changing the camera angle without using a middle mouse button.
Entries.keybinding.toolbar.next-toolbar.descript: Switch to the next toolbar category.
Entries.keybinding.toolbar.previous-toolbar.desc: Switch to the previous toolbar category.
Entries.keybinding.toolbar.next-variant.descript: Switch to the next unlocked variant during placement (i.e. to toggle between Rotator variants).
Entries.keybinding.toolbar.previous-variant.desc: Switch to the previous unlocked variant during placement (i.e. to toggle between Rotator variants).
Rotates the current structure clockwise by 90 degrees.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.rotate-ccw: Rotates the current structure counter-clockwise by 90 degrees.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.mirror.des: Flips or mirrors the current structure or blueprint.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.mirror-inv: Flips or mirrors the current structure or blueprint on the other side.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.switch-pat: While placing belts, use this hotkey to switch the corner a belt uses.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.place-chec: Anchors a belt, allowing you to drag it in any direction without changing anything before that point. Highly recommended to use since it makes placement much easier.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.rotate-bui: Rotate a structure during placement so it faces to the right.
Rotate a structure during placement so it faces to the left.
Rotate a structure during placement so it faces to the top.
Rotate a structure during placement so it faces to the bottom.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.transform-: Move the structure to a higher floor without changing the current floor. Useful for quickly moving blueprints or stackers.
Move the structure to a lower floor without changing the current floor. Useful for quickly moving blueprints or stackers.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.blueprint-: Hold this modifier key during placement to override existing buildings.
Entries.keybinding.building-placement.save-bluep: Saves the selection as a Blueprint in your Blueprint Library.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.select-base.de: The base button for all selection commands. While holding & dragging, use either <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> or <hotkey:mass-selection.deselect-area-modifier/>.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.select-single-: Click/select individual structures to add or remove them to the selection.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.select-area-mo: Hold this modifier key and drag with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-base/> to select one or multiple structures.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.deselect-area-: Hold this modifier key and drag with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-base/> to reduce your current selection.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.delete.descrip: Destroys all structures in the current selection.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.select-all-of-: Hold this key while clicking a structure icon in the details panel of a selection to change the selection to include only this type of structure.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.quick-delete-d: Hold and drag to delete structures. You can hold <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> to delete an entire area.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.pipette.descri: Clone the structure below the mouse cursor so you can place more copies.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.make-blueprint: Create a placeable copy of the current selection.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.paste-blueprin: Paste a blueprint from the system clipboard.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.select-connect: Selects all connected structures. Can be used multiple times to progressively expand it.
Entries.keybinding.mass-selection.clear-selectio: Clears all items & fluids within the selected structures.
Cuts the current selection so it can be placed elsewhere.
Entries.keybinding.waypoints.create-new.descript: Create new Marker at the current camera position & orientation.
Entries.keybinding.waypoints.jump-back.descripti: After jumping to a Marker or the Vortex Platform, use this to jump back to your previous location.
Entries.keybinding.waypoints.center-on-base.desc: Jump back to your Vortex Platform.
Entries.keybinding.waypoints.edit-below-cursor.d: Hover a marker on the side and use this hotkey to edit it.
Entries.keybinding.debug.debug-console-autocompl: Try to auto-complete the current command input.
Entries.keybinding.debug.debug-console-select-pr: Go back to the previous command(s) issued.
Entries.keybinding.debug.debug-console-select-ne: Go forward to the next command(s) issued.
Entries.keybinding.debug.generic.description: Execute a command that was stored with 'console.bind-hotkey' previously.
Entries.keybinding.debug.fast-speed.description: For debugging purposes only. This is NOT a fast forward toggle and will cause your factories to run at less precision!
Entries.edit-keybindings.title: Edit Keybinding
Entries.edit-keybindings.description: Press one or multiple keys or mouse buttons you would like to assign to "<name/>":
Entries.keybinding-helpers.area-delete.title: Delete Area
Entries.keybinding-helpers.area-delete.descripti: Drag with <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> + <hotkey:mass-selection.quick-delete-drag/> to delete structures within an area.
Entries.building.HubBuilding.title: <copy-from:global.empty/>
Entries.building-variant.HubDefaultVariant.title: <copy-from:global.empty/>
Entries.building.BeltBuilding.title: Conveyor Belt
Entries.building-variant.Lift1LayerVariant.title: 1 Floor Lift
Entries.building-variant.Lift1LayerVariant.descr: Transports items between floors. Automatically placed during belt placement.
Entries.building-variant.Lift2LayerVariant.title: 2 Floor Lift
Entries.building-variant.Lift2LayerVariant.descr: Transports items between floors. Automatically placed during belt placement.
Entries.building-variant.Merger2To1Variant.title: 2-Way Merger
Entries.building-variant.Merger3To1Variant.title: 3-Way Merger
Entries.building.ExtractorBuilding.title: Extractor
Entries.building-variant.ExtractorDefaultVariant: Extracts shapes and outputs them on belts.
Entries.building.CutterBuilding.title: Cutting
Entries.building-variant.CutterDefaultVariant.de: Separates the <highlight>WEST HALF</highlight> of any shape from the <highlight>EAST HALF</highlight>, and outputs both separately.
Entries.building-variant.CutterHalfVariant.title: Half Destroyer
Entries.building-variant.CutterHalfVariant.descr: Destroys the <highlight>WEST HALF</highlight> of any shape, outputting what remains.
Entries.building.RotatorBuilding.title: Rotator
Entries.building.TrashBuilding.title: Trash
Entries.building-variant.BeltPortSenderVariant.d: Sends items flying, which allows <highlight>transportation over buildings and between Platforms</highlight>.
Entries.building-variant.BeltPortReceiverVariant: Catches flying items sent with Launchers.
Entries.building.PipeBuilding.title: Pipe
Entries.building-variant.PipeDefaultVariant.desc: Allows fluid transportation. Pipes do not have a capacity limit.
Entries.building-variant.Pipe1LayerVariant.title: Pipe Up/Down
Entries.building-variant.Pipe1LayerVariant.descr: Allows fluid transportation across floors. Pipes do not have a capacity limit.
Entries.building-variant.Pipe2LayerVariant.title: Pipe 2-Up/Down
Entries.building-variant.FluidBridgeSenderVarian: Launches fluids to transport them between platforms.
Entries.building.PumpBuilding.title: Pump
Entries.building.FluidStorageBuilding.title: Fluid Tank
Entries.building-variant.FluidStorageDefaultVari: Allows excessive fluid to be stored. Has a lower priority than other fluid buildings.
Entries.building.PainterBuilding.title: Painter
Entries.building-variant.PainterDefaultVariant.d: Paints the <highlight>top layer</highlight> of a shape.
Entries.building.MixerBuilding.title: Color Mixer
Entries.building-variant.MixerDefaultVariant.des: <wip-warning/>Allows paint to be mixed, following <highlight>additive color mixing (RGB)</highlight> logic.
Entries.building.SandboxBuildings.title: Sandbox Buildings
Entries.building-variant.SandboxItemProducerDefa: Produces one full belt of a given shape.
Entries.building-variant.SandboxFluidProducerDef: Produces an infinite amount of a given fluid.
Entries.building.StackerBuilding.title: Stacker
Entries.building-variant.StackerDefaultVariant.d: Allows shapes to be stacked on top of each other.
Entries.building.PinPusherBuilding.title: Pin Pusher
Entries.building-variant.PinPusherDefaultVariant: <wip-warning/>Pushes the whole shape up and places a pin below every non-empty quadrant on the first layer.
Entries.building.WireDisplayBuilding.title: Display
Entries.building.WireButtonBuilding.title: Button
Entries.building-variant.ButtonDefaultVariant.de: <wip-warning/>Can be toggled to output either null or 1.
Entries.building-variant.BeltFilterDefaultVarian: <wip-warning/>Outputs items to the output if they match the signal, otherwise outputs them to the top. If the signal is null or a conflict, blocks the belt. If the signal is an integer signal, forwards the whole belt if it is truthy, otherwise blocks the whole belt.
Entries.building.VirtualProcessorBuilding.title: Virtual Processors
Entries.building-variant.VirtualAnalyzerDefaultV: <wip-warning/>Outputs the base shape and color of the upper-right quadrant of the shape on the first layer.
Entries.building-variant.VirtualUnstackerDefault: <wip-warning/>Outputs the topmost layer of a shape on one layer, and the remaining layers on the other output. Does not break crystals.
Entries.building-variant.VirtualStackerDefaultVa: <wip-warning/>Outputs the result of stacking two shapes.
Entries.building-variant.VirtualHalfCutterDefaul: <wip-warning/>Outputs the result of destroying the WEST side of a shape.
Entries.building-variant.VirtualPainterDefaultVa: <wip-warning/>Outputs the result of painting a shape (topmost layer only).
Entries.building-variant.WireTransmitterSenderVa: <wip-warning/>Allows to exchange wire signals between space platforms.
Entries.building-variant.WireTransmitterReceiver: <wip-warning/>Allows to exchange wire signals between space platforms.
Entries.building.LabelBuilding.title: Label
Entries.building.CrystalGeneratorBuilding.title: Crystal Generator
Entries.building-variant.CrystalGeneratorDefault: <wip-warning/><highlight>Fills empty/pin quadrants</highlight> of a shape with paint & and hardens it into <highlight>crystal</highlight>.
Entries.building.ArtistPlaygroundBuilding.title: Test Building
Entries.building-variant.ArtistPlaygroundBuildin: This building is used by our artists to test metrics & dimensions.
Entries.building.HalvesSwapperBuilding.title: Swapper
Entries.building-variant.HalvesSwapperDefaultVar: Receives two shapes and <highlight>swaps their WEST HALVES</highlight>, outputting the results in parallel and allowing for <highlight>more efficient processing</highlight>.
Entries.building.TrainStationBuilding.title: Train Station
Entries.building.WireBuilding.title: Wire
Entries.building-variant.WireBridgeVariant.title: Wire Bridge
Entries.building-variant.WireBridgeVariant.descr: <wip-warning/>Allows you to cross two wires without them intersecting.
Entries.building.LogicGateBuilding.title: Logic Gate
Entries.building-variant.LogicGateAndVariant.des: <wip-warning/>Outputs 1 if both signals are truthy, otherwise 0.
Entries.building-variant.LogicGateOrVariant.desc: <wip-warning/>Outputs 1 if one or both signals are truthy, otherwise 0.
Entries.building-variant.LogicGateXOrVariant.des: <wip-warning/>Outputs 1 if exactly one both signals is truthy, otherwise 0.
Entries.building-variant.LogicGateNotVariant.des: <wip-warning/>Outputs 1 if the signal is not truthy, otherwise 0.
Entries.building-variant.LogicGateCompareVariant: <wip-warning/>Outputs 1 if the both signals match the configured comparison, otherwise 0.
Entries.building-variant.LogicGateIfVariant.desc: <wip-warning/>Outputs the input signal if the control signal is truthy, otherwise null.
Entries.building.TunnelBuilding.title: <copy-from:global.empty/>
Entries.building-variant.TunnelExitVariant.title: <copy-from:global.empty/>

Entries.research-info.tooltip-research.title: Research Points
Entries.research-info.tooltip-research.descripti: Research Points are used to unlock speed upgrades and additional content.
Entries.research-info.tooltip-blueprints.title: Blueprint Points
Entries.research-info.tooltip-blueprints.descrip: Delivering specific shapes grants you Blueprint Points. You can view the shapes by clicking on the arrow to the right.
Entries.research-tree.title: Research
Entries.research-tree.next-milestone-locked: Deliver the requested shape to the Vortex to unlock this technology and its side goals.
Entries.research-tree.level-info-button.title: Show Rewards
Entries.research-tree.level-info-button.descript: Click to show the rewards gained for this milestone.
Entries.research.tree.dialog-confirm-linear-upgr: Are you sure you want to upgrade by spending research points? This can not be changed afterwards.
Entries.research.node-unlocked: You have already unlocked this research.
Entries.research.research-linear-upgrade-not-unl: Unlock further technologies to gain access to this upgrade.

Entries.research.end-of-demo.title: End Of Demo
Entries.research.end-of-demo.text-wishlist:
Wishlist Shapez 2 now to get notified on Early Access launch later this year!

The full version contains Space Trains, Fluids, 3rd Floor, Crystals, Pins & much more!
Entries.research.RNInitial.title: Belts & Extractors
Entries.research.RNInitial.description: Allows shapes to be extracted and transported.
Entries.research.RNLayer3.title: 3rd Floor
Entries.research.RNLayer3.description: Unlocks the third floor including 2-floor lifts.
Entries.research.RNStackerLayer2.title: Stacker
Entries.research.RNStackerLayer2.description: Unlocks the Stacker, allowing shapes to be stacked/combined.
Entries.research.RNTrains.title: Trains
Entries.research.RNTrains.description: Allows massive amounts of shapes to be transported over long distance.
Entries.research.RNCrystals.title: Crystals
Entries.research.RNCrystals.description: Allows fluids to be crystallized inside empty shape quarters.
Entries.research.RNIslandBuilding.title: Space Platforms
Entries.research.RNIslandBuilding.description: Allows new space platforms to be built, expanding your factory.
Entries.research.RNBlueprints.title: Blueprints
Entries.research.RNBlueprints.description: Allows you to copy/paste parts of your factory.
Entries.research.RNFluids.title: Fluids & Painting
Entries.research.RNFluids.description: Allows you to extract fluids & color shapes.
Entries.research.RNWires.title: Wires
Entries.research.RNWires.description: <wip-warning/>Placeholder upgrade, will give you nothing for now.
Entries.research.RNFluidPacking.title: Fluid Packing
Entries.research.RNFluidPacking.description: Packages fluids, allowing them to be transported between space platforms as well as trains.
Entries.research.RNDevTools.title: End of Alpha
Entries.research.RNDevTools.description: This is not an actual milestone.
Entries.research.RNHubSize.title: More Vortex Inputs
Entries.research.RNHubSize.description: Increases the size of the Vortex to allow for more inputs.
Entries.research.RNIslandLayouts1.title: Platform Layouts 1
Entries.research.RNIslandLayouts1.description: Unlocks a larger space platform layout.
Entries.research.RNIslandLayouts2.title: Platform Layouts 2
Entries.research.RNIslandLayouts2.description: Unlocks a larger space platform layout.
Entries.research.RNIslandLayouts3.title: Platform Layouts 3
Entries.research.RNIslandLayouts4.title: Platform Layouts 4
Entries.research.RNChunkLimit.title: Platform Limit
Entries.research.RNChunkLimit.description: Increase the maximum amount of space platform units you can place.
Entries.research.RNBlueprintEfficiency.title: Blueprint Discount
Entries.research.RNBlueprintEfficiency.descripti: Makes Blueprints free up to a certain amount of structures.
Entries.research.RNDummyNodeA.title: Vortex Technology
Entries.research.RNDummyNodeB.title: Dimensional Generator
Entries.research.RNDummyNodeB.description: <wip-warning/>Experimental technology for creating interconnected pocket universes.
Entries.research.RNDemoChallenge.title: Shape Challenge
Entries.research.RNDemoChallenge.description: Complete extra goals for bonus platform capacity (and bragging rights).
Entries.research.RNDemoChallenges.title: Demo Challenges

Entries.wiki.locked-entry: Unlock "<research/>" to get access to this information.
Entries.wiki.WKIntroduction.title: Getting Started
Entries.wiki.WKIntroduction.text-intro-1: Welcome to the Shapez 2 Knowledge Panel! To advance in your role as an Operator, you will need to build structures capable of completing Research Goals.
Entries.wiki.WKIntroduction.text-intro-2: <highlight>All goals require that you deliver a specific Shape to the Vortex. Completing them grants you upgrades and access to new Structures.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKIntroduction.text-intro-3:
Placing an <glossary>Extractor</glossary> and directly delivering what it produces won't be sufficient for long.
As you complete more goals and gain access to more tools as an <glossary>Operator</glossary>, the required <glossary>Shapes</glossary> will grow in complexity and challenge your skills.
Entries.wiki.WKIntroduction.text-shapes-1: Geometric objects mined by specialized <glossary>Space Platforms</glossary>, <glossary>Shapes</glossary> are composed of smaller sections, named <glossary>Quarters</glossary>, that can be separated and reorganized.
Entries.wiki.WKIntroduction.text-shapes-2: Similar to cakes, <glossary>Shapes</glossary> can have multiple layers, each with up to 4 distinct <glossary>Quarters</glossary>. Different types of <glossary>Quarters</glossary> can be found by expanding deeper into space.
Entries.wiki.WKIntroduction.text-vortex-1: Constructed to harness the Vortex, this platform is the only connection to the Vortex System that enables your building capabilities and much more.
Entries.wiki.WKIntroduction.text-vortex-2: All <glossary>Shapes</glossary> required to complete <link:wiki.WKResearch>Research Goals</link> must be launched directly into the <glossary>Vortex</glossary> at the core of the platform, so that they can be researched.
Entries.wiki.WKEssentialControls.title: Basic Controls
Entries.wiki.WKEssentialControls.text-camera-1: Drag and hold <hotkey:camera.mouse-drag-modifier/> to move the camera - alternatively you can also use <hotkey:camera.move-up/>, <hotkey:camera.move-left/>, <hotkey:camera.move-down/>, <hotkey:camera.move-right/>.
Entries.wiki.WKEssentialControls.text-camera-2: To change the rotation and angle, hold <hotkey:camera.angle-drag-modifier/> and move the mouse horizontally to change the direction, and vertically to change the perspective.
Entries.wiki.WKEssentialControls.text-camera-3: The camera automatically snaps to 30 degree increments by default. You can change this by clicking the magnet icon in the bottom left corner of the screen.
Entries.wiki.WKEssentialControls.text-placement: To place buildings, select them from the toolbar (Hotkeys: <hotkey:toolbar.select-slot-0/> to <hotkey:toolbar.select-slot-8/>) and press <hotkey:building-placement.confirm-placement/> to confirm the placement.
Entries.wiki.WKEssentialControls.text-placement-: You can also clone the building right under your cursor with <hotkey:mass-selection.pipette/> (Pipette/Clone Tool).
Entries.wiki.WKEssentialControls.text-deletion:
To delete buildings, you can hold and drag <hotkey:mass-selection.quick-delete-drag/>. If you want to undo/redo an operation you can also use <hotkey:main.undo/> to undo, and <hotkey:main.redo/> to redo the last operations.

You can also hold <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/> while dragging with <hotkey:mass-selection.quick-delete-drag/> to delete an entire area quickly.
Entries.wiki.WKEssentialControls.text-selection: To select an area, hold <hotkey:mass-selection.select-area-modifier/>. You can also select/deselect single buildings by holding <hotkey:mass-selection.select-single-modifier/> instead. And if you want to deselect a whole area, you can hold <hotkey:mass-selection.deselect-area-modifier/>.
Entries.wiki.WKToolbar.title: Toolbar
Entries.wiki.WKToolbar.text-intro: The <glossary>Toolbar</glossary> is an <glossary>Operator's</glossary> primary tool when constructing <glossary>Space Factories</glossary> capable of completing all types of <link:wiki.WKResearch>Research Goals</link>.
Entries.wiki.WKToolbar.text-category-1: <highlight>Selecting a Category changes which Structures can be accessed through the Toolbar.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKToolbar.text-category-2: All unlocked <glossary>Structures</glossary> can be found grouped within different categories. Each category contains <glossary>Structures</glossary> related to a shared functionality - for example, 'FLUIDS' includes all <glossary>Structures</glossary> that utilize fluids & those required to connect and transport between them.
Entries.wiki.WKToolbar.text-structure-1: <highlight>Selecting a Structure will activate its placement, showing a preview under your cursor of where it will be materialized.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKToolbar.text-structure-2: Structures are anything that you, as an <glossary>Operator</glossary> can construct in Space while building factories. These can range from smaller <glossary>Buildings</glossary>, built directly on floors, to <glossary>Space Platforms</glossary> and even <glossary>Trains</glossary>.
Entries.wiki.WKToolbar.text-scope-1: <highlight>To toggle between Building and Platform Mode instantly, press <hotkey:main.scope-change/>. Otherwise, zooming past certain points will change your Mode automatically.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKToolbar.text-scope-2: Your current <glossary>Mode</glossary> defines what tools and <glossary>Structure Categories</glossary> you have access to. The <glossary>Building Mode</glossary> allows you to place <glossary>Structures</glossary> directly onto <glossary>Platform</glossary> floors. The <glossary>Platform Mode</glossary> allows you to expand your factory by placing additional <glossary>Platforms</glossary> and <glossary>Train Mode</glossary> allows you to create <glossary>Rail Paths & Train Lines</glossary> between them.
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.title: Building Bigger
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-intro: As the goal requirements increase, at some point you may <highlight>feel like a goal requires too much</highlight>. Rest assured, as an <glossary>Operator</glossary>, you are more than capable of completing any challenge in your way. However, if you ever feel lost - the following concepts might help tackling those goals in an organized way.
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-modularity-1: Even if it sounds unfamiliar, this concept is present in everyone's lives. Think of cooking: <highlight>each step requires different tools and appliances</highlight> - such as knives or an oven. If you are roasting a whole chicken, you will need a large oven, but you can still use the same knives. <highlight>When one part of the process is changed, the others still function independently</highlight> - you don't need to throw away your whole kitchen.
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-modularity-2:
Utilizing <glossary>SHAPEZ-2</glossary>, you would also be able to clone tools or turn them into <link:wiki.WKBlueprints>Blueprints</link>.
If you <highlight>build parts of your factory as independent tools</highlight>, that serve a specific purpose, then they're no longer interdependent. This is <glossary>Modularity</glossary>, and <highlight>it allows you to easily modify, improve and expand</highlight> as parts can be reused and exchanged, instead of completely rebuilt.
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-small-1: <highlight>If a section of your factory does everything, it can only be replaced by a new section that does everything. By designing modular sections with smaller purposes, they can be more easily altered, replaced or duplicated.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-small-2: When placing buildings to complete a larger goal, it helps to <highlight>build different parts</highlight> of the process, such as <link:wiki.WKCutting>Cutting</link>, <link:wiki.WKRotating>Rotating</link> or <link:wiki.WKStacking>Stacking</link> <highlight>in separate sections</highlight>. This allows you to easily change, replace or copy them to alter the functionality & throughput of factories.
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-medium-1: <highlight>If platforms are designed with singular purpose, such as Cutting or Rotating - then you have given yourself the ability to place them just as you did with Buildings, on a much larger scale.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-medium-2: When building factories on <glossary>Space Platforms</glossary>, outside the <glossary>Vortex Platform</glossary>, you can make your duties as an <glossary>Operator</glossary> easier by reapplying the concepts you learned on a new scale.
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-medium-3: By creating <glossary>Space Platform</glossary> designs with a singular function, such as a platform that only cuts <glossary>Shapes</glossary>, you ensure that they can be cloned or <link:wiki.WKBlueprints>Blueprinted</link> when you need that function again, just like placing Buildings.
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-large-1: <highlight>By understanding <glossary>Modularity</glossary> and applying its concepts on multiple scales, you can achieve the ability of creating super massive Space Factories with ease.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKExpanding.text-large-2: When building Space Factories on a massive scale, if you have designed <glossary>Platform Modules</glossary> for different functions, then the concepts learned from <glossary>Building Sections</glossary> can be used again. With that, sections of interconnected <glossary>Platform Modules</glossary> with a singular function can be cloned or <link:wiki.WKBlueprints>Blueprinted</link> when building new <glossary>Space Factories</glossary> or expanding existing ones.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.title: Belts, Mergers & Splitters
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-intro: <glossary>Conveyor Belts</glossary> and all other draggable <glossary>Structures</glossary> utilize <glossary>Smart Placement</glossary>, allowing you to create and modify complex paths with little more than dragging your cursor.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-start: After you select a belt from the <link:wiki.WKToolbar>Toolbar</link>, it will automatically connect its input to adjacent buildings. You can change the output direction by pressing <hotkey:building-placement.rotate-cw/>. Once you are satisfied with the starting belt, press <hotkey:building-placement.confirm-placement/> and <highlight>DRAG</highlight> your cursor to its destination.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-merge-split: <highlight>To merge or split belts, you don't need to select a different structure</highlight>. When you start dragging from a belt, drag over a belt or into a belt, they will automatically adjust to connect with your new path, creating splitters & mergers as necessary.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-dragging-1: While dragging, use to place an Anchor and to flip the path direction.
Entries.wiki.WKBeltPlacement.text-dragging-2: The belt will automatically connect itself to adjacent outputs. You can change the output direction by pressing <hotkey:building-placement.rotate-cw/>. You can also <highlight>drag the path over a building to force a connection</highlight> - for destructive buildings like the Trash, this is often the best solution.
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.title: Research
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.text-intro: To complete <glossary>Research Goals</glossary>, you need to deliver the required <glossary>Shapes</glossary> to the <glossary>Vortex</glossary>.
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.text-tiers: <glossary>Main Goals</glossary> give you access to new <glossary>Side Goals</glossary> & content - <glossary>Main Goals</glossary> also unlock technologies that ensure you are able to produce all goals you may have available.
Entries.wiki.WKResearch.text-side: <glossary>Side Goals</glossary> are not mandatory, but can be of great assistance in improving what you can build - the technologies unlocked from <glossary>Side Goals</glossary> are diverse, from <glossary>Structure Variants</glossary> to <glossary>Speed Upgrades</glossary> and more.
Entries.wiki.WKCutting.title: Shape Cutting
Entries.wiki.WKCutting.text-intro: The <glossary>Quarters</glossary> that make up a <glossary>Shape</glossary> can be separated and altered. <glossary>Buildings</glossary> of the <glossary>Cutting</glossary> type will assist you in isolating, separating or swapping the <highlight>WEST HALF</highlight> of any shape.
Entries.wiki.WKCutting.text-destroyer: The <glossary>Half-Destroyer</glossary> uses the isolator laser to disintegrate the <highlight>WEST HALF</highlight> of a <glossary>Shape</glossary>, outputting anything that remains.
Entries.wiki.WKCutting.text-cutter: The <glossary>Cutter</glossary> utilizes a holographic blade to split a <glossary>Shape</glossary> in two, separating its <highlight>WEST HALF</highlight> and outputting it in parallel.
Entries.wiki.WKCutting.text-swapper: The <glossary>Swapper</glossary> utilizes two holo-blades, allowing it to simultaneously split <glossary>Shapes</glossary> and swap their <highlight>WEST HALVES</highlight>, before outputting both.
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.title: Shape Rotating
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.text-intro: <glossary>Rotating</glossary> is not required when delivering <glossary>Shapes</glossary> to the <glossary>Vortex</glossary> - but the <glossary>Rotation</glossary> of <glossary>Shapes</glossary> when entering a <glossary>Structure</glossary> affects how they are processed.
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.text-cutting: All <link:wiki.WKCutting>Cutters</link> separate the <highlight>WEST HALF</highlight> of a <glossary>Shape</glossary>. By <glossary>Rotating</glossary> a <glossary>Shape</glossary>, you can control which half is cut. This allows you to cut, rotate and cut again to produce <glossary>Quarters</glossary>.
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.text-stacking: <glossary>Shapes</glossary> are <link:wiki.WKStacking>Stacked</link> as if they fell on top of each other. By rotating a <glossary>Shape</glossary>, you can control which part falls where. This is what allows two halves to become a whole <glossary>Shape</glossary> or end up on top of one another.
Entries.wiki.WKRotating.text-rotator: The default building rotates your shape by 90 degrees clockwise, allowing for all four rotations to be achieved. There also additional <glossary>Variants</glossary> for rotating counter-clockwise or by 180 degrees, enabling more elegant builds.
Entries.wiki.WKStacking.title: Shape Stacking
Entries.wiki.WKStacking.text-intro: Separate <glossary>Shapes</glossary> can be combined into one through <glossary>Stacking</glossary>, this can be used to make <glossary>Shapes</glossary> with multiple layers and/or to combine different <glossary>Quarters</glossary> into a single layer.
Entries.wiki.WKStacking.text-stacker-1: The <glossary>Stacker</glossary> receives <glossary>Shapes</glossary> from two floors - as the upper <glossary>Shape</glossary> is dropped on top of the lower, any disconnected sections will fall until they hit a solid surface.
Entries.wiki.WKStacking.text-stacker-2: If both <glossary>Shapes</glossary> are whole, they'll end up on top of each other - for <glossary>Shapes</glossary> full of empty or loose <glossary>Quarters</glossary>, some parts can fall further before landing.
Entries.wiki.WKLayers.title: Floors
Entries.wiki.WKLayers.text-intro: You can now place <glossary>Buildings</glossary> and belts on multiple floors. To switch floors, use <hotkey:camera.select-layer-up/> and <hotkey:camera.select-layer-down/>.
Entries.wiki.WKCrossLayerBelts.title: Belts Across Floors
Entries.wiki.WKCrossLayerBelts.text-intro-1: <highlight>Start dragging and press <hotkey:camera.select-layer-up/> to go up or <hotkey:camera.select-layer-down/> to go down - this will automatically create a lift.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKCrossLayerBelts.text-intro-2: To transport items across floors, you need to build <glossary>Belt Lifts</glossary> connecting them - this can be done with a few simple steps.
Entries.wiki.WKCrossLayerBelts.text-step-1: Select the <glossary>Conveyor Belt</glossary> from the <glossary>Toolbar</glossary> and <highlight>DRAG <hotkey:building-placement.confirm-placement/></highlight> to the where you want to move the belt up/down to a different floor.
Entries.wiki.WKCrossLayerBelts.text-step-2: While still dragging, press <hotkey:camera.select-layer-up/> to go up one floor, or <hotkey:camera.select-layer-down/> to go down. A <glossary>Belt Lift</glossary> will automatically anchor the path.
Entries.wiki.WKCrossLayerBelts.text-step-3: Continue dragging the path until you're satisfied, then release <hotkey:building-placement.confirm-placement/> to confirm placement.
Entries.wiki.WKCrossLayerBelts.text-step-4: You can use <link:wiki.WKBeltPlacement>Anchors</link> <hotkey:building-placement.place-checkpoint/> and move up/down more than once while dragging, and even cancel a <glossary>Lift</glossary> by moving the floor back where it was placed.
Entries.wiki.WKPinPusher.title: Shape Support Pins
Entries.wiki.WKPinPusher.text-intro: WARNING: This section is outdated and contains wrong information.
Entries.wiki.WKPinPusher.text-pusher-1: The <glossary>Pin-Pusher</glossary> replaces the <highlight>NORTH-EAST QUARTER</highlight> of a shape with a <glossary>Support Pin</glossary>. These supports can hold anything stacked on top and can be stacked themselves.
Entries.wiki.WKPinPusher.text-pusher-2: By using one or more stacked <glossary>Support Pins</glossary>, you can create <glossary>Shapes</glossary> that would otherwise be impossible - with large gaps and sections elevated by multiple layers.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.title: Space Platforms
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-intro-1: Unlocking <glossary>Space Platforms</glossary> allows you to expand your <glossary>Space Factories</glossary> beyond the <glossary>Vortex Platform</glossary> and grants you access to the <link:wiki.WKToolbar>Platform Mode</link> toolset.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-intro-2: Once unlocked, these massive <glossary>Structures</glossary> can be <highlight>built directly in space</highlight>. Regular layouts serve as foundations for <glossary>Buildings</glossary>; unique layouts, like miners, have a specific purpose.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-belt-1: <highlight>After <link:wiki.WKEssentialControls>Selecting</link> Space Belts from the <link:wiki.WKToolbar>Platform Mode Toolbar</link>, drag a path and place anchors as you would with belts.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-belt-2: To facilitate transportation between neighboring <glossary>Space Platforms</glossary>, the <glossary>Space Belt</glossary> tool can create platform paths, working as massive & simplified version of <glossary>Conveyor Belts</glossary>.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-miner-1: <highlight>Miner Platforms can only be placed on top of Asteroids - once placed, the resource can obtained through the Shape Patch by placing the appropriate Buildings.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-miner-2: To create Shape <glossary>Extraction Points</glossary> for your factories, specialized <glossary>Asteroid Miner Platforms</glossary> are required - they can be found under the 'Extraction' category in the <link:wiki.WKToolbar>Platform Mode Toolbar</link> and must be placed on top of <glossary>Shape Asteroids</glossary>.
Entries.wiki.WKPlatforms.text-layout: To create <link:wiki.WKExpanding>Platform Modules</link> or simply expand a factory's buildable area, <glossary>Space Platforms</glossary> serve as foundations for your structures. Additional forms & sizes can be unlocked as you advance through your goals as an <glossary>Operator</glossary>.
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.title: Blueprints
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-intro-1: <highlight>With Blueprints, you can easily replicate Structure sections you've already built - as long as you have enough Blueprint Points.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-intro-2: In your duties as an <glossary>Operator</glossary>, you will often need something you already have built again in a new area, and again, and then again and again. This is why <glossary>Blueprints</glossary> are often one of the best tools one can unlock.
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-blueprinting-1: <highlight>After <link:wiki.WKEssentialControls>Selecting</link> Structures, Clone them with <hotkey:mass-selection.make-blueprint/> or save a Blueprint with <hotkey:building-placement.save-blueprint/>.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-blueprinting-2: Any amount of <glossary>Buildings</glossary> or <glossary>Platforms</glossary> can be selected and turned into a placeable copy of the original. For short-term use, <highlight>Cloning</highlight> <hotkey:mass-selection.make-blueprint/> will create a temporary Blueprint - while <highlight>Saving a Blueprint</highlight> <hotkey:building-placement.save-blueprint/> stores them inside your <glossary>Blueprint Library</glossary>.
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-points-1: Placing a <glossary>Blueprint</glossary> requires <glossary>Blueprint Points</glossary>. The cost grows rapidly based on the amount of <glossary>Structures</glossary> being placed - cloning small parts and <link:wiki.WKExpanding>Building Sections</link> is more cost-efficient than copying whole factories.
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-points-2: <highlight>Blueprint Goals can be checked through the BP Point counter at the top of the screen.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-points-3: To obtain <glossary>Blueprint Points</glossary>, special <highlight>Blueprint Goal shapes must be delivered to the Vortex</highlight>. There are multiple <glossary>Blueprint Goals</glossary> which are revealed as it becomes possible to create them - complex goals are worth more points.
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-library-1: <highlight>Any structure selection can be saved to the Library with <hotkey:building-placement.save-blueprint/> - it only needs a name.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-library-2: The <glossary>Blueprint Library</glossary> allows <glossary>Operators</glossary> to save & load designs directly into their disk. The <glossary>Library</glossary> can be accessed with <hotkey:main.toggle-blueprint-library/> or its designated button at the top-right of the screen.
Entries.wiki.WKBlueprints.text-library-3: To place <glossary>Blueprints</glossary> saved in the <glossary>Library</glossary>, find it in the list and <hotkey:building-placement.confirm-placement/> select it. Saved <glossary>Blueprints</glossary> can be edited or deleted through the pencil & trashcan buttons respectively.
Entries.wiki.WKWelcome.title: Welcome, Operator, to the Vortex Platform
Entries.wiki.WKWelcome.text-intro-1: To advance in your role as an <glossary>Operator</glossary>, you will need to complete <glossary>Research Goals</glossary> by delivering <glossary>Shapes</glossary> directly to the <glossary>Vortex</glossary>. <highlight>Completing them grants you upgrades, new structures and more challenging goals.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKWelcome.text-intro-2:
If you have any doubts or questions, you can call up further information at any time.
<highlight>The Knowledge Panel can be accessed by pressing <hotkey:main.toggle-wiki/> or through top-right of the screen.</highlight>
Entries.wiki.WKWelcome.text-intro-3: Your plans lie in wait - it is time to continue!

Entries.blueprint-library.title: Blueprint Library
Entries.blueprint-library.empty-hint:
No saved blueprints found. Press <hotkey:building-placement.save-blueprint/> while having a blueprint selected to save it here.

Your blueprint library is synchronized between savegames & devices.
Entries.blueprint-library.btn-refresh.title: Refresh
Entries.blueprint-library.btn-refresh.descriptio: Reload the blueprint library from your hard drive
Entries.blueprint-library.btn-open-bp-folder.des: Open the blueprint library folder on your hard drive.
Entries.blueprint-library.add-new.title: Save Blueprint
Entries.blueprint-library.add-new-folder.title: Add Folder
Entries.blueprint-library.edit-existing.title: Edit Blueprint
Entries.blueprint-library.edit-existing.descript: Enter a name for the blueprint. This will also be used as the file name in the blueprint library folder, so it has to be unique. Invalid characters will be replaced.
Entries.blueprint-library.bottom-hint: Right click an entry to edit. Drag & Drop is supported. The library is synchronized to your disk, so you can also edit it in the system file explorer.
Entries.blueprint-library.dialog-confirm-overrid: A blueprint with the name '<name/>' already exists. Are you sure you want to overwrite it?
Entries.blueprint-library.dialog-confirm-folder-: Are you sure you want to remove the folder '<name/>'? This will delete all contained blueprints and can NOT be reverted.
Entries.blueprint-library.dialog-save-failed.des: Failed to save the blueprint. Make sure you enter a valid name.
Entries.blueprint-library.dialog-rename-failed.d: Failed to rename. Make sure you enter a valid name, and that no entry with this name already exists.
Entries.blueprint-library.dialog-parent-change-f: Failed to move blueprint. Make sure you enter a valid name, and that no entry with this name already exists.
Entries.blueprint-library.dialog-remove-failed.d: Failed to remove the blueprint for unknown reasons.
Entries.blueprint-library.dialog-folder-create-f: Failed to create the folder for unknown reasons. Make sure the name is not already taken.
Entries.blueprint-library.trash.title: Trash
Entries.blueprint-library.trash.description: Drag an entry here to remove it. This can not be reversed.
Entries.blueprint-shortcut-bar.title: Blueprints
Entries.blueprint-shortcut-bar.description: Bind blueprints to the toolbar in the blueprint library.
Entries.keybinding-overview.title: Hotkey Overview
Entries.keybinding-overview.intro-text: More hotkeys can be found and configured in the Hotkey Settings.
Entries.tutorial.skip-tutorial-button.title: Mark Completed
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_CameraMovement: Use , , , or drag with to move the camera.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_CameraRotation: HOLD to ROTATE the camera. If you don't have a middle mouse button, use and as a temporary solution.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_BeltCheckpoint: Drag and press to ANCHOR your path, allowing you to build multiple corners and zigzags.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_SplitBelt: SPLIT belts by dragging FROM an existing belt.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_UndoRedo: You can UNDO and REDO any action. Undo your last action with to continue.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_OpenKeybindingHi: Open the HOTKEY OVERVIEW in the upper right.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_OpenShapeViewer: Click any shape in the interface to open the SHAPE VIEWER.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_OpenWiki: The KNOWLEDGE PANEL contains useful information and tips. Press to open it.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_MirrorBuilding: Press <hotkey:building-placement.mirror/> to select the mirrored variant of this building.
Entries.tutorial.TSSkillAcademy_JumpToHUB: Lost? Click the <highlight>Home Icon</highlight> or press <hotkey:waypoints.center-on-base/> to jump back to the Vortex Platform.
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_0_PlaceExtractor: Select the EXTRACTOR with and place it on the SHAPE PATCH.
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_1_PlaceBelts: Shapes must be delivered to the VORTEX. Select the CONVEYOR BELT with and drag to place it.
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_2_MoreExtractors: EXPAND factories to avoid waiting. Place 4 Extractors (/4).
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_3_Merge: MERGE the Belts by dragging them onto existing ones.
Entries.tutorial.TSFirstLevel_4_CompleteMileston: Your MAIN GOAL is above this hint. Complete the goal.
Entries.tutorial.TSHalfCutter_0_PlaceExtractor: The new goal requires SQUARES. Explore the Vortex Platform to find new resources and extract them.
Entries.tutorial.TSHalfCutter_1_PlaceHalfCutter: New unlocks allow PROCESSING shapes in different ways. Place 6 Half Destroyers (/6).
Entries.tutorial.TSHalfCutter_2_ConnectAndDelive: The Vortex accepts ANY ROTATION Deliver the main goal shape.
Entries.tutorial.TSRotator_0_ChainOperations: Shapes can be processed in MULTIPLE STEPS. Place a Rotator between Half Destroyers to deliver the goal.
Entries.tutorial.TSRotator_1_SideGoalsHint: SIDE GOALS give powerful upgrades. Deliver the suggested goal below.
Entries.tutorial.TGBlueprints_0_SelectArea: Use BLUEPRINTS to duplicate factories and avoid manual labor. SELECT buildings using + .
Entries.tutorial.TGBlueprints_2_PlaceBpSpendPoin: Cloning costs BLUEPRINT POINTS. Deliver specific Shapes to get points, shown above. Spend at least 50 Points (/50).
Entries.tutorial.TSStacker_0_PlaceStacker: STACKING combines two shapes. Place 4 Stackers, each with a gap between them (/4).
Entries.tutorial.TSStacker_1_ConnectStackers: Use and to switch floors. Connect the stackers and deliver the goal shape.
Entries.tutorial.TSStacker_2_PlaceStructureOnLay: You can build Structures on all floors. Place a Rotator or Half Destroyer on the second floor.
Entries.tutorial.TSLayer2_0_PlaceLiftUpDown: Use and to SWITCH FLOORS. CROSS over belts by changing the floor while dragging a belt.
Entries.tutorial.TSLayer2_1_UsePredictions: Waiting for shapes is not required. Previews show results in advance. Complete the goal.
Entries.tutorial.TGIslands_0_SwitchIslandMode: SPACE PLATFORMS allow you to expand past your Vortex Platform. Press or zoom out to switch into PLATFORM MODE.
Entries.tutorial.TGIslands_1_Extractor: Select an ASTEROID MINER from the second toolbar category. Place it on the red star Shape Asteroid next to the Vortex Platform.
Entries.tutorial.TGIslands_2_SpaceBelts: Use SPACE BELTS to easily connect platforms. Drag them like a regular belt. Use to rotate the entrance/exit, and to anchor it. Connect the Asteroid Miner to the Vortex Platform.
Entries.tutorial.TGDemoComplete_0_Wishlist: Thank you for playing the demo! Be sure to WISHLIST and FOLLOW Shapez 2 on Steam to get notified on release! We have also added a few challenge goals if you want to continue playing.
